intro: Coursetia caribaea var. ochroleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered coursetia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean region. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local biodiversity.
